title.native: 名探偵コナン　ベイカー街(ストリート)の亡霊
title.romaji: Meitantei Conan: Baker Street no Bourei
title.english: Case Closed: The Phantom of Baker Street

description:
Conan was invited to a party with many other guests. They were there to test a new virtual game system, when a murder mystery occured. Now Conan must go into the game system to figure out who the murderer is with the help of the famous book character Sherlock Holmes. The lives of 49 kids testing the game are in his hands.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Meitantei Conan Movie 06: Baker Street no Bourei
Detektiv Conan: Das Phantom der Baker Street
Detective Conan Movie 06: Il fantasma di Baker Street

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Crossover
tags.description: Centers around the placement of two or more otherwise discrete fictional characters, settings, or universes into the context of a single story.

tags.name: Classic Literature
tags.description: Discusses or adapts a work of classic world literature.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

title.native: 名探偵コナン

name.native: ジャック・ザ・リッパー
ジェームズ・モリアーティ教授
アイリーン・アドラー
セバスチャン・モラン大佐

node.description:
__Favorite Food:__ Rice with curry

Gosho Aoyama, alternatively known by his real name Yoshimasa Aoyama, is a Japanese mangaka and animator, best known as the creator of Detective Conan (internationally known as Case Closed), Magic Kaito, and YAIBA.

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芝美奈子)

Noted for her character designs on [Black Butler](https://anilist.co/anime/4898/), [Noir](https://anilist.co/anime/272/), [Tegami Bachi](https://anilist.co/anime/6444/) among many others.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%93%E3%81%A0%E3%81%BE%E5%85%BC%E5%97%A3) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenji_Kodama)

Kenji Kodama is a Japanese director and storyboard artist. He is best known for being one of the main directors on the long-running anime [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/), as well as the [City Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/1470/) series and [Lupin III: Part III](https://anilist.co/anime/1426/).

Married to animator [Sachiko Kamimura](https://anilist.co/staff/112663/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Official Site](https://bz-vermillion.com) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/Bz) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Bz_Official)

B'z  is a Japanese hard rock duo.   

Members: 
Tak Matsumoto (松本孝弘) - composition, guitar 
[Koshi Inaba](https://anilist.co/staff/264247) (稲葉浩志) - lyrics, vocals
Joined Audio Planning U in 1982, where he studied under [Yasuo Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/111277/).

He is an animator and character designer. Motohashi started working at Studio Z. Later, after leaving Studio Z, he started together with Hirayama Satoshi and Kamegaki Hajime Studio Z5. Today he is affiliated with Xebec and is the representative director of its subsidiary Xebec M2.
Lead vocalist of the rock duo __[B'z](https://anilist.co/staff/102048/Bz)__.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/須藤昌朋)

Originating from Studio Annapuru, currently freelance.

Debuted as an in-betweener on the second season of [Ashita no Joe](https://anilist.co/anime/2921/). He is particularly known for his involvement in [TMS Entertainment's](https://anilist.co/studio/73/) works, mainly the [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/) franchise, in which he has served as a character designer and animation director on all of the theatrical movies.
Lead vocalist of the rock duo __[B'z](https://anilist.co/staff/102048/Bz)__.

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suwacchi)

Michihiko is a producer, planner and supervisor. He is a chief producer at Yomiuri Telecasting Corporation.
